article.bdy:
GEOS may refer to:
GEOS (eikaiwa) , one of the private eikaiwa, or English conversation teaching companies, in Japan.
GEOS (8-bit operating system) , (Graphic Environment Operating System) was an operating system from Berkeley Softworks (later GeoWorks). It was originally designed for the Commodore 64 and released in 1986.
GEOS (16-bit operating system) , PC/GEOS, later known as GeoWorks, is a DOS-based graphical user interface and x86 operating system first created by Berkeley Softworks, later GeoWorks Corporation, for the IBM PC and similar systems.
GEOS (securities processing software)
, an integrated online system for the management and processing of securities, developed in Austria, by Software Daten Service
Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite
, (or GOES) program is a key element in United States' National Weather Service (NWS) operations. (A redirect from GEOS (satellite))
This page lists articles associated with the same title. If an internal linkled you here, you may wish to change the link to point directly to the intended article.''
